title: Octagonal Font
content:
Hi everybody,

Can anyone name this beauty, and for bonus points, the font at the bottom?

Many thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015035735im_/http:/typophile.com/files/octagonalfont_5215.jpg)
author: malbright

comments.content: The big one is actually hexagonal, but I don't know its name either.
Sorry, don't know this one but would like to. Do you have more information? Origin, website (obviously)?

This not fonted design by Martin Benka (1956) has some similarities ..  
 [http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-62820.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015035735/http:/luc.devroye.org/fonts-62820.html "http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-62820.html")

The font came from William Staehle's wonderful site:

[http://silhouettemasterpiecetheater.com/silent-night/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015035735/http:/silhouettemasterpiecetheater.com/silent-night/ "http://silhouettemasterpiecetheater.com/silent-night/")

Thanks so much for helping!

By the way, to see more of Will's work, go here. It's great.

[http://willco.co](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015035735/http:/willco.co/ "http://willco.co")

Thank you. Found another image of that typeface from Staehle's site.  
 [http://silhouettemasterpiecetheater.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/upsel...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015035735/http:/silhouettemasterpiecetheater.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/upsell_a_holidaycard.png "http://silhouettemasterpiecetheater.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/upsell\_a\_holidaycard.png")
Oh wow! Perfect. Thank you so much for helping!
